text: Analysis of structural variations based on earlier array studies using low-density probes showed the presence of various types of gain and/or loss of genomic fragment encompassing CEACAM/ PSG genes [47, 48, 49, 50] . These CNVs range from a few kb to as large as 0.8 Mb in a small fraction of individuals ( Fig. S4 in File S1). Consistently, recent data based on high-density probe comparative genome hybridization analysis and/or genome sequencing indicated that CNVs at the CEACAM/PSG locus are pervasive, and most of these CNVs are results of large segmental duplications (Fig. 5a) [51, 52, 53] .
